intro: [WRONG START] Embilia sootepensis, commonly known as Sootep Embelia, is a small shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its medicinal properties, it is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
